embeds.title: Pick of Rhapsody
embeds.description:
Common Relic / The Guardian / Downfall

You can now Mine for 2 **Gems** at Rest Sites (up to 3 times).
*With as many gemstones that litter the Spire, it is hard to imagine anyone so unlucky to have needed this Pick to aid them.*

I can't recall ever getting this, but it seems like you could get some good out of it. Knowing you have future gems coming means you can prioritize socket cards and close together fires

This relic is, as the crowd suggests, generally quite bad. If you get it from the Gem Mine event, the ability to get free uses out of its charges can be actually helpful in fishing for the really good gems (Quartz/Citrine/Onyx), so in the event context it is fun and good,  but outside of that context  it's hardly worth forgoing lots of upgrades for. The fundamental problem is that you usually don't need more than 6 or so gems in a run at all, unless you luck into an Exploit Gems, and absolutely anything is good enough in that monstrosity. Sometimes you can afford to speculate a little on a Prismatic, but usually you do that when you already have at least one thing to put into it. 

It's probably OK that Guardian has a bad relic here because its power level is pretty high; it's unfortunate, though, that it is a relic that is short-term a do-nothing because Guardian already has a lot of short-term bad, long-term good plays. 

Special hate-out to this relic for the time I had a coffee dripper and a fully upgraded deck at the final campfire and it forced me to take 2 garbage gems instead of being able to skip.
Note that does make this one of the unusual relics that is sometimes worth skipping.

embeds.title: Scry
embeds.description:
Keyword / Slay the Spire

Look at the top X cards of your draw pile. You may discard any of them.

messages.content: It says "discard" but it does not actually "discard"
It instead `Moves` cards from the draw pile to the discard pile
So its one of the few objectively wrong worded items in basegame, you can fairly easily <prismatic shard> into a situation where it does not work as advertised

embeds.title: Tactician
embeds.description:
Uncommon Skill / The Silent / Slay the Spire

**Unplayable**.
If this card is discarded from your hand, gain :green_energy: ( :green_energy:).

messages.content: The biggest one is "costs 0 for the turn" not actually being for the turn.

Getting this from the gem mine event by fighting the gremlins tends to be pretty powerful, but that's largely because you can burn through the charges at the same event without having to use up any campfire actions. The opportunity cost of using an entire campfire action to mine for 2 gems is very high, and actually makes your deck worse for the next several combats until you can find another campfire.  Random unsocketed gems are often very bad draws, and using pick of rhapsody at a campfire puts you in a power trough that is usually far too costly to consider. I don't think it's ever made sense for me to use this at a campfire before in over 15 guardian runs. As a small note in pick's favor, when it gives you a random gem, it has (I believe) an equal chance of being any of the possible gems, regardless of rarity, similar to how transforming a card has a relatively high chance of giving you an uncommon or rare. There are 4 common gems, 6 uncommon gems, and 2 rare gems, so you have a 2/3 chance to get an uncommon or better on each roll. 

I think this relic should probably be tied to the gem mine event only, or radically changed, because right now it is very weak when you get it as a random relic from things like fighting elites or opening chests. If it's going to take a full campfire action, there should still be a chance provided to socket the resulting gems, the opportunity cost is just too high otherwise. The other option I could see is making using pick of rhapsody a free action, but not giving the player the opportunity to socket the gems, which would make using it a more interesting choice of risk and reward, based on how strong your current deck is, and where the next campfire is. The other possibility is letting you choose 1 of 3 gems, but still having it take a full action and not let you socket the gems. If you do that, it's still very costly to use it, but the reward is more likely to be worth the risk.
Yeah there is a few ways to fix the relic, I wonder what they're gonna go for
Because I don't think there is a way they don't change it
